message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I think you'll really appreciate its unique features and benefits. I'm willing to start with a price of $12000, which I believe is a fair and reasonable offer considering its worth to you.
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, Alice, but I'm looking to save some money. I'm willing to pay $9500 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering its worth to me.

I understand that you're looking to save some money, Bob, but I have to consider my own needs as well. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I'm counteroffering at $11000, which is a $1000 discount from my initial offer. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to you.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still looking to save some money. I'm willing to pay $9800 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering its worth to me.

I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to make sure I'm not leaving money on the table. I'm counteroffering at $10500, which is a $500 discount from my previous offer. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to you, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, Alice, but I'm still looking to save some money. I'm willing to pay $9900 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering its worth to me.

I'm starting to think we're getting a bit too far apart, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to make sure I'm not losing too much. I'm counteroffering at $10250, which is a $250 discount from my previous offer. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to you, and I'm hoping we can finally come to an agreement.
I understand your concerns, Alice, but I'm still looking to save some money. I'm willing to pay $9800 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering its worth to me.

I'm getting a bit frustrated, Bob, but I'm still willing to negotiate. However, I need to make a profit, and I'm not willing to go any lower than $10000. I'm counteroffering at $10000, which is the minimum price I'm willing to accept. I hope you can meet me at this price.
